Class Appointment

java.lang.Object
userInfo.Appointment
public class Appointment extends Object
Represents an appointment for a patient with a doctor. It stores details like the appointment ID, patient ID, doctor ID, status, date, and time. The class provides methods to add, reschedule, or cancel appointments, and to interact with the underlying CSV file for persistence.

  • Constructor Details

    • Appointment

      public Appointment(Integer aID, String pID, String dID, String aS, String dA, String tA)
      Constructs an Appointment object with the specified details.
      Parameters:
      aID - The ID of the appointment.
      pID - The ID of the patient.
      dID - The ID of the doctor.
      aS - The status of the appointment (e.g., "Pending", "Confirmed", "Completed").
      dA - The date of the appointment (in the format "dd/MM/yyyy").
      tA - The time of the appointment (in the format "HH:mm-HH:mm").

    • setAppointmentStatus

      public void setAppointmentStatus(String Status)
      Updates the status of the appointment (e.g., "Canceled", "Confirmed", "Completed"). When this happens: 1. Patient cancels appointment (set to Canceled) 2. Doctor accepts appointment request (set to Confirmed) 3. Doctor declines appointment request (set to Canceled) 4. Doctor completes the appointment (set to Completed) a. Remember to create an AppointmentOutcomeRecord object when appointment is completed
      Parameters:
      Status - The new status for the appointment.

    • addNewAppointmentToCSV

      public boolean addNewAppointmentToCSV()
      Adds the new appointment to the CSV file for persistence.
      Returns:
      true if the appointment was successfully added, false otherwise.

    • rescheduleAppointmentInCSV

      public boolean rescheduleAppointmentInCSV()
      Reschedules the appointment and updates the corresponding CSV record.
      Returns:
      true if the appointment was successfully rescheduled, false otherwise.
